body.raw:
Already 2018 is looking like a party year for me with plenty of gigs/festivals syphoning $$ from my wallet. Here\'s a preview of what my feet and ears are anticipating so far

> 2018-01-20-Elrow-Australia-Psychadelic-Trip.jpg?

### **elrow** - _Psychadelic Trip_

I\'ve never really heard of Elrow until my shoot with [Jordan for **Hot Import Nights x ZEN**](http://www.zengarage.com.au/2017/11/hot-import-nights-x-jordan/): she\'s a dancer who has worked in Ibiza for a few seasons and mentioned that this crazy party was coming and worth checking out. Once I saw Nic Fanciulli was on the cards, it was pretty much decided; having wAFF from the Hot Creations stable

> 2018-01-27-Electric-Gardens-Festival.jpg?

### **Electric Gardens Festival**

Drawcards for me this year will be Dubfire, Nicole Moudaber, Henry Saiz, Fatboy Slim AKA Norman Cook, Armand Van Helden and MK.
Timetable management will be a tricky juggle. Good to see the collaboration between touring companies come together on this one.
Hoping for some glorious weather, and gorgeous girls too.

> 2018-02-03-Eclipse-Presents-James-Zabiela-Balance-Album-Tour.jpg?

### James Zabiela - _Balance Album Tour_

One never to miss when he\'s in town; the protege of DJ Sasha, is a magician behind the decks and effects

> 2018-02-10-Dave-Seaman-Tube-Burger.jpg?

### Dave Seaman & Tube + Berger

Dave has always been a DJ hero of mine ever since the good olde Global Underground series. We even made the trip from Canberra to Melbourne to see him play 4 hours at The Goods Shed, in the now developed Docklands as the inspiration for his GU020 Boxed mix. I can still remember having GU shaved into the back of my head, dancing into the early hours of the morning as he played Billie Jean (Bushwacka Remix) for a 3rd encore.  
Still a little unsure if I will be able to make this gig, as I may have a shoot on.
We\'ll have to see how the dates, times & locations line up.

> 2018-02-16-Shapeshifter.jpg?

### Shapeshifter

The ever epic 5 piece group never cease to amaze and put on a killer show.
I discovered these guys care of _Semi-Permanent_, & Umeric who made this film clip for \"Long White Cloud\"

> https://www.youtube.com/embed/yHnMcRUQP7U?

> 2018-02-24-Tell-No-Tales.jpg?

### Tell No Tales

That\'s a **HUGE** international line-up, but the killers for me are definitely Derrick Carter and Laurent Garnier. Carter for his Chi-Town house, and Garnier purely for \"_The Man with the Red Face_\"

> https://w.soundcloud.com/player/?url=https%3A//api.soundcloud.com/tracks/256070581

> 2018-03-03-Erick-Morillo-vs-Roger-Sanchez.jpg?

### Erick Morillo vs Roger Sanchez

How can you go wrong with these two heavy hitters?!?!
I have a whole bunch of Subliminal Records in my vinyl collection, and witnessed countless hours of both go nuts on marathon sets.
One by themself has been known to tire out a crowd, but both together is going to see the workforce thinned out for half a week.
If you want to part-take in the mayhem, I have a few extra tickets, so let me know ASAP before they go to the highest bidder.

> 2018-04-21-Lane-8-Little-By-Little-Tour.jpg?

### Lane 8 - _Little By Little_ Album Tour

Definitely excited for this tour. His debut album \"_Rise_\" was filled with plenty of great tracks treading the line between mainstream and deep house genres. Since then Lane 8 has started the label **This Never Happened** - with the concept: _remove all phones and cameras from the event, get back to connecting with the music and the people around you_.
The new album \"_Little By Little_\" will be released on the 19th January, and the preview tracks _No Captain_ & _Atlas_ are amazing.
Again, I have a few extra tickets if anyone wants to come along and connect with the music & me.

Definitely looking like a great party season. I\'m looking forward to getting my beat riding on, and hopefully launching a little something something whilst I\'m at it. Stay tuned for more details!!

`,(0,a.jsxDEV)(r.p,{children:["Dave has always been a DJ hero of mine ever since the good olde Global Underground series. We even made the trip from Canberra to Melbourne to see him play 4 hours at The Goods Shed, in the now developed Docklands as the inspiration for his GU020 Boxed mix. I can still remember having GU shaved into the back of my head, dancing into the early hours of the morning as he played Billie Jean (Bushwacka Remix) for a 3rd encore.",(0,a.jsxDEV)(r.br,{},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/samlaw/Desktop/00-CODE/cl/content/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-56f62578-2ef2-4880-a688-d07d43e4c9fe.mdx",lineNumber:38,columnNumber:427},this),`

`,(0,a.jsxDEV)(r.p,{children:`How can you go wrong with these two heavy hitters?!?!
I have a whole bunch of Subliminal Records in my vinyl collection, and witnessed countless hours of both go nuts on marathon sets.
One by themself has been known to tire out a crowd, but both together is going to see the workforce thinned out for half a week.
If you want to part-take in the mayhem, I have a few extra tickets, so let me know ASAP before they go to the highest bidder.`},void 0,!1,{fileName:"/Users/samlaw/Desktop/00-CODE/cl/content/posts/_mdx_bundler_entry_point-56f62578-2ef2-4880-a688-d07d43e4c9fe.mdx",lineNumber:63,columnNumber:1},this),`
